ygData.subject: RE: Lullaby interrupting casters
ygData.msgSnippet: I was finding this whilst soloing in Perma the other night too. The only thing I can think of is that they are somehow completing the spell before the nod
ygData.messageBody:
I was finding this whilst soloing in Perma the other night too. The only
thing I can think of is that they are somehow completing the spell before
the nod affects them even though they are still going through the somatics.
With restarting Lullaby every pulse to get the short pulse I was
interrupting less than 25% of the time.

Good Journey,

Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)


8)-----Original Message-----
8)From: John Kim [mailto:kim@...]
8)Sent: Monday, August 02, 1999 11:25 AM
8)To: eqbards@onelist.com
8)Subject: [eqbards] Lullaby interrupting casters
8)
8)
8)From: John Kim <kim@...>
8)
8)On Mon, 2 Aug 1999, Llewrend Lynnhaven wrote:
8)>
8)> I use lullabye when soloing or dueling casters as it
8)> interupts them. It helps in crowd control, but be
8)
8)Has anyone used Lullaby for this recently? I tried it against
8)three or four casting mobs in Cazic. They nodded off to sleep
8)probably about 50 times total, but I never saw a single
8)interrupt message immediately following a nods. Did I just
8)get extraordinarily unlucky with my timing, did they gimp
8)Lullaby, or are lizards able to cast in their sleep?
8)
8)--
8)John H. Kim
8)kim@...
8)
